episode_event_specialcos04_01/4001_1001_:
I’m happy to announce that we’ll be holding an
interactive mystery game!
Play a role and solve the mansion’s mysteries!
IF you can solve them! Hahahahaha!
So we’ve been invited as playtesters?

I will have you all act the roles you’re given
and play this mystery-solving game.

Among the roles you will play, there is a culprit
who will cause an incident...who is obviously
hiding their identity.

You will be asked to figure out who the culprit is
and what kind of incident happened.
Wow! That sounds like so much fun! ♪
Now then, draw to decide your roles!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/6801_1031_:
Playing a game with
everyone... This’ll make a
wonderful memory! ♪
episode_event_specialcos04_01/6801_1001_:
I’m the detective... I’ve been interested in
detectives for a while, actually.
I think it suits you, Steven!
Heh. I won’t let you down!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4002_1001_: Wow! You two get costumes? That’s nice!

Heehee! Does it suit me? Apparently, I’m the
detective’s assistant!
And I’m the detective.

They’re really putting a lot of effort into this event,
preparing costumes and all.

I’ll do my best to support you as
detective’s assistant!
Great! I’ll be counting on you!
I’m the musician... Are there no costumes for us?

We don’t have all the costumes yet, as we’re still
in the testing phase.

Awww... I would have liked to wear the
artist’s costume.

I can’t believe I don’t get to be the detective.
It would have been perfect for me...

But the main idea of the game is that you can
still make deductions even if you’re not the
detective, right?

Why don’t you just guess the culprit before
the detective does?

I suppose you’re right... Then I’ll stick with my role
as the gardener!
By the way, what’s your role, Agatha?

I’m the owner of the mansion. Why, am I a
suspect already?
I’m the cleaner?!

There’s no need for cleaning if you just smash
everything to bits!

I’m the sculptor... Don’t you go breaking any of
my art, now.
Does everyone know what role they’ll be playing?

Now, before we begin the game, let me go
over some simple rules.

Each participant has been given a role, and one of
those roles is the culprit!

However, the culprit has also been given an
additional role to serve as a decoy.

The culprit must use their decoy role to avoid
suspicion while causing “the incident.”

And everyone else should play their roles and try
to guess who the culprit is, right?

Indeed. To discover the culprit, it’s important to
figure out what happened in this mansion.

Piecing together what occurred is crucial to solving
the mystery!
I have a question!

Can you get help from your partner Pokémon
during the game?

That’s fine. The point of this game is to enjoy it as
a sync pair.

Do you understand the rules? If so, let the
games begin!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4003_1001_: It seems everyone’s acting out their roles.
Now, as the detective, this says I should...

Go around the mansion and observe the other
participants.
To the culprit, I’m just an annoying snoop.
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4004_1001_:
Oh, hey, Mr. Detective. Are you wandering around
because you’re bored?
Haha! Well, this IS my job...
Agatha, you’re the owner of the mansion, right?
That’s right. You should show me some respect.
And I’m the gardener!
What were you two doing just now?
We were talking about the Pokémon in the garden!

He was explaining a few things to me regarding
the Pokémon that live in the garden.
Could you clarify what you mean?
This mansion wasn’t originally mine.

It was seized from a distinguished family to clear
a debt.

So the Pokémon in the garden are from
that family.

Which means you’ve only recently started
living here?
That’s right.
Hey, Steven. ♪
I’m here to help you as the detective’s assistant!

I had a look around the mansion, and I memorized
the rooms! ♪
That’s amazing! Could you show me around?
Leave it to me. ♪
Well then, see you two later!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4005_1001_: Here, this is the art studio!
Oh, wow! You’re making a sculpture out of ice! ♪
Ahaha! Fitting for a sculptor, right?
Be careful not to slip on the leftover shards!

By the way, I heard there’s treasure somewhere in
this mansion.
And I might be interested in that treasure...
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4006_1001_: Tch! Why do I have to be the one cleaning?
You don’t like your role, Guzma?

Well, duh. Also, the cleaner supposedly doesn’t
like the owner of the mansion.

If that’s the deal, then I don’t need to waste my
time acting. I can just keep complaining, since
it fits the part.
You’re right. Acting might be your calling!
Sh-shut it! I’m busy right now! Go away!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4007_1001_: This place has a beautiful view. ♪
Is the artist duo having a chat?

Yep! We were just talking about how it would
have been great if our roles were swapped!

I’m just going around talking to everyone right
now. Have you noticed anything out of
the ordinary?

I was supposed to say something specific to
anyone who asked a question!
Hmm... Are you supposed to tell them that?
What? Is that against the rules?
No, you’re not breaking the rules.

But if you’re the culprit, what you just said would
be extremely disadvantageous for you...

B-but if I don’t say anything now, that’s even
more suspicious, right?

So, in this mansion, there’s an old painting of a
little girl.

And as an artist, I was drawn to that
painting! Errr, supposedly.

So that means it’s a painting of Agatha, the owner
of the mansion?
The mansion’s treasure has been stolen!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4008_1101_:
A treasure was stolen from the locked
treasure vault!

The participants shared the information they had
and organized their thoughts on the situation...
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4008_1001_:
Looker and Agatha have been together since the
beginning of the game. So have Lyra and Burgh.

Since there’s only one culprit, those four
have alibis.

It means you can prove that you weren’t at the
crime scene when the incident occurred.

Right, so the four of them can vouch for
each other!

Which means there’re two suspects—Guzma
and Melony?!
There’re four if you include me and Shauna.

We met up at one point, but before that, we were
working separately.

So, who’s the most suspicious out of the four
right now?

A-are you saying I’m the culprit?! I haven’t been
in no treasure vault!

I have the keys to some of the rooms so I can
clean, but I don’t have the key to the treasure
vault!

Guzma’s telling the truth. I have the key.
See? Here it is.
As the owner of the mansion, I have all the keys.
Are those really all of your keys, Agatha?

If Agatha had the keys, no one else can get into
the room, right?
I think we need to investigate a bit more...
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4009_1001_: We’ve got to look for a clue...
It may have confused it with a pretty rock!

There are times when Stoutland does bring me
rocks, but...
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4010_1001_:
So there was a shard of ice at the scene of
the crime...
Melony! You’re the culprit, aren’t you?!

What?! You’re accusing me just because there was
ice at the scene?

You worked together with Lapras and made a
key to the door out of ice!

Then you used the ice key to get into the room
and steal the treasure—and made it look locked
by locking the door again!

The motive could be that you wanted the treasure
for a sculpture...
Hold on a minute! That’s all just speculation!

But the only ones who can freely manipulate ice
are you and Lapras!

Light has been shone on the darkness of
this case...
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4011_1001_: The real culprit is...you!
Shauna!
Whaaat?!
You suspect me, Steven?

Yes, I’m sure of it. If you want to prove
your innocence...

I want you to show us that none of Klefki’s keys
can open the treasure vault.
If you can’t do that...
What do you mean?
Klefki has this mansion’s master key.

If my deduction is correct, this mansion should
have a master key.

Whaaat?! How did you guess that? Tell
me, Steven!
Of course.

To start, the aim of this game isn’t just to
guess the culprit.

We also have to figure out what happened in this
mansion, right?
Lyra.

You said there’s an old painting of a little girl in
this mansion, correct?

Burgh said it must be a painting of Agatha, the
owner of the mansion, but...

This mansion was seized from a prestigious family,
and Agatha has only recently started living here.

So it would be weird to have an “old” painting
of Agatha.
Then the girl in the painting is...

Yes. She’s the girl from the prestigious family who
used to live in this mansion.

What if that girl was looking for a chance to steal
the treasure back?
And you’re saying that’s Shauna?

Yes. It wouldn’t be strange for the culprit—
and by culprit, I mean the original owner of
the mansion...

to, like Agatha, have special items to help them
play their role in this game.

I suspect Agatha doesn’t have the master key to
this mansion...

because when she showed me what keys she had,
Klefki didn’t express any interest in them.

The fact that Klefki have a tendency to like master
keys is just further proof.

But you could just hide the keys...and Melony could
be the girl from the painting, right?
Aww, a “girl”?

And the painting could have been brought in
by Agatha!
And there was a shard of ice at the crime scene...
Yes, and that was the conclusive proof.
What?
My Stoutland gave the shard of ice to you.

It knew from the smell left on the ice that you
dropped it, Shauna.

That’s the proof that you left the ice there, so
Melony would look suspicious.

The ice shard...from when you were talking
to me?
That’s another suspicious thing.

Even if you did search the mansion, you’re still far
too knowledgeable about it.

So knowledgeable that your role could only be
someone who’s lived here previously!
Now, Shauna. Hand over Klefki’s keys.
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4011_1101_:
One of Klefki’s keys opened the door to the
treasure vault...
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4011_1001_: Aw, man. You got me! ♪
Amazing, Steven. Everything is as you explained.

Shauna was the culprit, and she was given a map
of the mansion and the master key along with
her outfit.
Aww, I couldn’t fool Steven!
No, you were a very good culprit, Shauna.
You completely fooled me!
You got me with that cute face of yours!
Heehee... ♪
He—he’s not here?!
Wh-what happened?!
My partner Pokémon...
was stolen!
episode_event_specialcos04_01/4011_1101_:
A real case that wasn’t part of the game
has begun!
